Question
========
Below is the formula of a single regression model of Y. ** **Y = a + b<sub>1</sub> \* X<sub>1 </sub>  What does the "a" in the formula mean? And what value does it take?

Answerlist
----------
* This is the significance level, this value is determined by the researcher. and is usually 0.05.
* This is the intercept, this value is 0 if X<sub>1 </sub> has no effect on Y.<sub> </sub>
* This is the constant, this is the value of Y if X<sub>1 </sub>is equal to 0.<sub> </sub>
* This is the alpha, this value belongs to a certain t-statistic and we have to look up in a table.
* This is the value of the alternative hypothesis (H<sub>a</sub>), this value is calculated by SPSS from the sample data.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* False
* True
* False
* False
